department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: green rabbit with flat oval resting on its back; floral motif on flat oval; has blue storage box (L1.1 MS)
medium:
San-ts'ai ware
Stoneware with three-color glaze
text: This charming rabbit was most likely made to function as a wristrest. Supports were sometimes used to steady the wrist while writing difficult calligraphy. The rabbit became popular during T'ang as a creature associated with the moon and immortality often being shown mixing the elixer of long life.
title: Wrist Rest in the Form of a Rabbit
